title: 'Hissing door mid-air': AI flight to Hong Kong spooks flyers; crew use napkins to 'fix' issue
content: An Air India flight from Delhi to Hong Kong experienced a mid-air door malfunction, causing unsettling noises and shaking. Flight attendants used napkins to mitigate the issue, and the flight landed safely. Similar incidents have occurred on Boeing 787s previously, though experts assure that such door issues don't compromise flight safety, highlighting the redundancy in safety measures.

title: 'Destroying evidence': Rahul Gandhi targets EC again; poll body reacts
content: Rahul Gandhi has intensified his criticism of the Election Commission, alleging a lack of transparency and the destruction of vital election data. The EC defended its decision to erase CCTV footage 45 days post-election, citing voter privacy and potential misuse. Officials stated that releasing webcasting footage could compromise voter security and contravene legal provisions, despite claims of promoting democratic integrity.

title: 'Serious lapses': DGCA orders Air India to remove 3 top officials; issues show-cause notice
content: Following the tragic Air India Flight AI-171 crash in Ahmedabad, the Directorate General of Civil Aviation has directed Air India to remove three senior officials from crew scheduling roles. The crash, involving a Boeing 787-8 Dreamliner, resulted in 241 fatalities.

title: Odisha dept transfers doctor 2 months after death; asks officer to join immediately
content: In a bizarre oversight, the health department in Sundargarh district promoted Dr. Smruti Ranjan Samal, a block public health officer who passed away in April, to additional public health officer (TB). The order, issued amidst a cholera outbreak, also transferred the deceased doctor to the district headquarters hospital. Officials attribute the error to a communication lapse regarding Samal's death.

title: How Bill Gates and Melinda Gates reacted when their daughter announced her startup
content: Phoebe Gates, daughter of Bill Gates, has launched Phia, an e-commerce app co-founded with Sophia Kianni. The platform utilizes AI to compare prices across numerous websites, offering users a comprehensive view of both new and second-hand fashion items. Bill Gates initially expressed concern about potential financial requests and involvement but ultimately supported Phoebe's entrepreneurial endeavor.

title: Air India crash crew member Irfan Shaikh laid to rest after DNA match
content: Irfan Shaikh, a 22-year-old Air India crew member who perished in the Ahmedabad plane crash last week, was laid to rest in Pimpri Chinchwad on Saturday. His remains were identified through DNA matching. The London-bound AI 171 crashed shortly after takeoff, killing all 241 on board and 29 on the ground.

title: 'Will never permit': J&K CM on Indus diversion to Punjab; ally Cong fumes
content: A dispute has erupted among northern states over the central government's plan to divert surplus water from the Indus system. Jammu and Kashmir's chief minister Omar Abdullah opposes redirecting water to Punjab, citing drought-like conditions in his region. This stance has drawn criticism from Punjab's Congress MP, who emphasised Punjab's patriotism and contributions to national security.

title: 'Maybe US wants to attack anyway': Iran foreign minister on Trump's 2-week window
content: Iranian Foreign Minister Abbas Araghchi suggests the United States might be using negotiations as a cover for a planned attack on Iran, questioning America's commitment to diplomacy. He accuses Washington of betrayal, especially after Israel's strikes on Iranian nuclear targets just before scheduled talks. Araghchi states Iran is willing to negotiate, but demands Israel cease its aerial attacks first.

title: Jeff Bezos wedding: Here's the designer gift 'VIP guests may receive'
content: Jeff Bezos and Lauren Sanchez are reportedly getting married next week in Venice, Italy, with a star-studded guest list. VIP attendees will receive lavish gifts, including hand-blown glassware from Laguna B. Bezos' superyacht, Koru, will be anchored off San Giorgio Maggiore island, which may be closed to visitors. The celebration will feature pastries from Rosa Salva Venetia.

title: IND vs ENG: Did Shubman Gill break rules? ICC rulebook provides clarity
content: Shubman Gill's impressive Test captaincy debut, marked by a brilliant century against England, is slightly overshadowed by a potential ICC violation. Gill was seen wearing black socks, breaching regulations that mandate white, cream, or light grey socks. This fashion faux pas could lead to a reprimand or fine, despite his stellar performance and India's dominant position at 359/3 at stumps.

title: Man hacked to death for urinating near chicken shop
content: In Chhatrapati Sambhajinagar, a dispute over public urination near a poultry shop escalated into a fatal cleaver attack, resulting in the death of Nitin Sankpal and injuries to two others. Police arrested five individuals, including the shop owner, Mastan Qureshi.

title: IND vs ENG: Stuart Broad rips into England bowlers, says 'they didn't quite get it right'
content: Shubman Gill's unbeaten century, complemented by Yashasvi Jaiswal's ton, propelled India to a dominant position on Day 1 of the opening Test against England at Headingley. India finished at 359 for 3 after being put into bat, with Rishabh Pant adding late fireworks. Stuart Broad criticized England's bowling tactics, suggesting adjustments to their field settings and lengths.

title: Amazon gives employees 30 days 'deadline' to …. or resign in 60 days
content: Amazon is requiring numerous corporate employees to relocate to major hubs like Seattle and Arlington, creating anxiety amidst job insecurity and AI-driven workforce reductions. Affected employees face short deadlines to decide, with no severance offered for those who resign instead of moving. This relocation push intensifies Amazon's in-office requirements and aligns with warnings of upcoming AI-related layoffs.

title: Watch: Moment Israel kills Iran’s ‘weapons kingpin’ in deep strike inside Tehran
content: The IDF announced the killing of Behnam Shahriyari, commander of the Quds Force's Weapons Transfer Unit, responsible for funneling weapons and funds to Iranian proxies. Saeed Izadi, a senior IRGC commander and key liaison with Hamas, was also eliminated in a separate strike.

title: IND vs ENG: 'Neeche hi reh ... ' - Rishabh Pant's stump-mic warning to Shubman Gill goes viral during Leeds Test
content: India dominated day one of the first Test against England, concluding at 359/3. Shubman Gill led with an unbeaten 127, supported by Yashasvi Jaiswal's century and Rishabh Pant's aggressive 65. Pant even advised caution to Gill, captured by the stump mic. This strong start marks a promising beginning for India in the Anderson-Tendulkar Trophy, showcasing their batting prowess.

title: 'Who are you?' AI voices answer calls of Iranian disapora trying to contact kin
content: Following Israeli airstrikes on Iran, Iranians abroad are met with robotic voices when calling home due to a widespread communication blackout. These AI messages, ranging from unsettling to strangely comforting, are suspected to be a government tactic to prevent hacking or spread confusion.

title: Banarasi sarees: What makes them special? Here are 10 reasons for their everlasting charm
content: Banarasi sarees, originating from Varanasi, are exquisite silk heirlooms steeped in history and culture, blending Indian traditions with Mughal artistry. These sarees, known for intricate craftsmanship and luxurious fabrics like silk and zari, feature diverse styles and motifs, holding cultural significance and social status. Despite challenges from machine-made imitations, initiatives promote sustainability to preserve this timeless craft.

title: 'Israel spreading terror': Slip-up by US envoy to UN goes viral; watch video
content: A US diplomat, Dorothy Shea, created a stir at a UN Security Council meeting by mistakenly blaming Israel for regional chaos before correcting herself to point the finger at Iran. Despite the gaffe, Shea reaffirmed US support for Israel, particularly regarding actions against Iran's nuclear ambitions.

title: IND vs ENG: 'Bhaiya yaar...' - Watch Jaiswal's frustrated reaction after Gill says 'no'
content: India dominated Day 1 of the first Test against England, reaching 359 for 3 at stumps, thanks to centuries from Yashasvi Jaiswal and Shubman Gill. The pair's 123-run partnership steadied the innings after India lost two quick wickets. A near run-out incident involving Gill added drama, followed by lighthearted banter between Jaiswal and Gill regarding running between the wickets.

title: IND vs ENG: 'He comes from Punjab ...' - Bharat Army's new song for Gill
content: Shubman Gill, facing initial skepticism as India's Test captain, silenced critics with a remarkable unbeaten century on the first day of the Leeds Test. Alongside Yashasvi Jaiswal's century, Gill propelled India to a strong position of 359 for 3 at stumps. Gill's achievement places him among Indian legends who scored centuries in their first Test as captain.

title: 'Because it became public?': Priyank Kharge questions MEA's 'U-turn' on US visit
content: Priyanka Kharge, Karnataka minister, announced that the Union government reversed its decision. He received permission for an official US visit. The Ministry of External Affairs issued an NOC after initially denying clearance. Kharge questioned the initial denial and timing. He highlighted Karnataka's role in national initiatives. He also emphasized the need for answers from the central government regarding the matter.

title: SBI reopens officer jobs: Class 10/12 English now counts; 2,964 posts up for grabs
content: The State Bank of India (SBI) has reopened applications for 2,964 Circle Based Officer (CBO) posts under Advertisement No. CRPD/CBO/2025-26/03. Candidates from Arunachal Pradesh and Nagaland with English as a subject in Class 10 or 12 are now eligible for the North East Circle. The application window is open from June 21 to June 30, 2025. Selection involves an Online Test, Interview, and Language Test. Eligible candidates must have a graduate degree and two years of officer-level experience.

title: Kanishka bombing: Canada police identifies 'Mr X'; refuses to disclose his name
content: The RCMP has identified "Mr. X," who assisted in testing the bomb weeks before the 1985 Kanishka bombing. Despite identifying him, his name remains undisclosed due to privacy laws, even after his death. This revelation comes as the 40th anniversary of the tragedy approaches, where 329 lives were lost when the Air India flight exploded off the coast of Ireland.

title: After ‘stupid, stupid!’ remark in Australia, Gavaskar makes new Pant admission: 'It seems like ...'
content: Sunil Gavaskar has changed his view on Rishabh Pant's batting. He praised Pant's measured approach in the recent Test match. Gavaskar noted Pant's ability to balance defence and attack. Shubman Gill and Yashasvi Jaiswal also performed well. India ended Day 1 with a strong score of 359/3. Pant remained not out at 65, hitting two sixes.

title: Headingley weather: Will rain play spoilsport on Day 2? Latest weather in Leeds
content: India dominated Day 1 of the first Test against England at Headingley, Leeds, reaching 359/3. Shubman Gill's unbeaten 127 and Rishabh Pant's 65 put England's bowling under pressure. However, the weather forecast predicts thunderstorms, potentially disrupting play later in the day after Yashasvi Jaiswal also scored a century.

title: Bihar polls: Nitish Kumar hikes pension; move to benefit over 1 crore
content: Nitish Kumar, Bihar's chief minister, has declared an increase to the state's Social Security Pension Scheme. The monthly pension will rise from Rs 400 to Rs 1100. This benefits elderly citizens, persons with disabilities, and widowed women. The revised scheme starts in July. The government will directly transfer the funds to beneficiaries' accounts monthly.

title: IND vs ENG: 'Where are they getting 20 wickets?' Broad sounds alarm bells
content: Before the Test series, Stuart Broad voiced concerns about England's inexperienced bowling attack. His worries proved valid as India dominated Day 1, reaching 350 for 3 with centuries from Shubman Gill and Yashasvi Jaiswal. Tim Southee defended Ben Stokes' decision to bowl first, despite criticism from Michael Vaughan, highlighting the team's thought process behind the choice.

title: 'We assemble, China profits': Rahul slams 'Make in India'; takes shot at PM Modi
content: Rahul Gandhi criticised PM Narendra Modi's 'Make in India' initiative. He points to low manufacturing rates and high youth unemployment. Gandhi highlights increased imports from China. He shares a video interacting with young people in Delhi. Gandhi alleges the PLI scheme is being rolled back. He calls for reforms and financial support for local producers.

title: Op Sindhu: India to also evacuate citizens of Nepal & Sri Lanka from Iran
content: India broadens its evacuation operation in Iran. This follows requests from Nepal and Sri Lanka. Operation Sindhu aims to rescue nationals from the region. A flight carrying Indian citizens landed in Delhi from Ashgabat. Previously, 290 Indian students returned from Mashhad after airspace reopened. The Indian Embassy provides emergency contacts for Nepal and Sri Lanka citizens.

title: IND vs ENG: How Shubman Gill got his century-hitting bat fixed - watch
content: Shubman Gill's unbeaten 127 propelled India to 359 for 3 on Day 1 against England at Headingley, marking a stellar start to his Test captaincy. Gill remarkably used a repaired bat, fixed by Cricfix_batservices after it was damaged in training.

title: 'Won't get Nobel': Trump again claims credit for India-Pak de-escalation
content: Donald Trump asserted his role in resolving global conflicts, including India-Pakistan tensions, claiming he deserves a Nobel Peace Prize, which he believes he won't receive. He highlighted his involvement in Serbia-Kosovo, Egypt-Ethiopia, and the Abraham Accords. However, India has firmly denied any foreign mediation in its engagement with Pakistan, emphasizing direct military-to-military dialogue for de-escalation.

title: Protein overload and kidneys: The silent strain you didn’t see coming
content: High-protein diets, popular for weight loss, pose hidden risks to kidney health. Dr. Bhanu Mishra warns that excessive protein intake forces kidneys to overwork, potentially causing long-term damage, especially for those with or at risk of kidney disease. Overconsumption, particularly of animal proteins, can disrupt acid-base balance and impair kidney function.

title: IND vs ENG: Gill, Bairstow's heated sledging war resurfaces - viral video
content: Shubman Gill's captaincy debut at Headingley, marked by an unbeaten century, has brought back memories of his verbal sparring with Jonny Bairstow during the 2024 India-England series. The resurfaced clip shows a sharp exchange between the two, adding spice to the ongoing series where Gill's leadership and batting acumen signal a confident start for India.

title: Vande Bharat scuffle: BJP MLA alleges abuse; passenger claims assault by associates
content: A dispute on the New Delhi-Bhopal Vande Bharat Express led to the filing of a non-cognizable report by BJP MLA Rajeev Singh. The incident, involving a disagreement over seats and an 'objectionable' posture, escalated at Jhansi station. A passenger was allegedly assaulted by individuals linked to Singh.

title: RJ Mahvash, linked with Chahal, shuts down trolls: 'Sine 2019, I've been ...'
content: RJ Mahvash has directly addressed online trolls who attributed her success to her association with cricketer Yuzvendra Chahal. She refuted these claims by showcasing her career achievements since 2019 in a video posted on social media.

title: ‘Mayday’: Guwahati-Chennai flight aborts landing; runs thin on fuel
content: The pilot of IndiGo flight 6E-6764 (A321), which took off from Guwahati at 4.40pm, attempted to land at Chennai around 7.45pm, but decided to ‘go around’ after the landing gear touched the runway in a procedure called ‘balked landing’.

title: Global shame! India tops WADA doping list; ministry plans stricter actions
content: India faces a significant challenge in combating doping, as evidenced by the latest Wada report, which ranks the nation first globally in dope offenders with 214 adverse analytical findings in 2023. This alarming situation has prompted authorities to revive the 'National Anti-Doping Bill 2022', incorporating Wada's suggestions to avoid potential suspension of NADA.

title: UP shocker: Husband forces woman to 'marry' lover; case filed
content: In a shocking incident in Ghazipur, a married woman, Priyanka Kumari, was forced to marry her lover, Pintu Gond, at a temple by her husband and villagers. Priyanka, already married to Rohit Kumar, was caught with Pintu, leading to the forced ceremony.

title: Japan snubs US: Why Tokyo pulled plug on 2+2 security talks
content: Japan has called off a key meeting with the United States. This decision followed a demand from Washington for Tokyo to significantly increase its defense spending. The US wanted Japan to raise its defense budget to 3.5 percent of GDP. An upcoming election in Japan also influenced the decision to postpone the security talks.

title: 'Every player should retire immediately': Never-seen-before drama in cricket field - Watch
content: In a dramatic Eliminator in Maharashtra's premier T20 league, Vicky Ostwal survived a bizarre fielding error. Kolhapur Tuskers missed a crucial run-out opportunity. Ostwal then scored 74 runs. Raigad Royals defeated Kolhapur Tuskers. The Royals advanced to Qualifier 2. They will now face Puneri Bappa. Ostwal's lucky break became a viral moment. Kolhapur will remember this costly mistake.

title: 'Whole of Ukraine is ours’: Putin claims; issues 'last mistake' warning
content: Vladimir Putin declared Russians and Ukrainians as "one people," implying Russia's claim over Ukraine, while denying intentions to destroy the country. He stated that peace hinges on Ukraine accepting Russia's territorial gains and neutrality. Putin warned Ukraine against using a "dirty bomb," threatening a catastrophic response, amidst ongoing Russian military actions and accusations of Ukrainian shelling.

title: We did 'bada yoga': Shinde recalls Shiv Sena split; takes dig at Uddhav
content: Maharashtra's deputy CM Eknath Shinde linked International Yoga Day to his 2022 Shiv Sena rebellion, terming it a "big yoga" that reshaped the state's political landscape. He stated that the split led to stability and development under the guidance of PM Modi and Amit Shah.

title: Early vs. late college applications: When should you apply to study abroad?
content: Applying early for international studies offers advantages like higher admission and scholarship chances, along with ample time for visa and housing arrangements. Late applications can work if used to strengthen profiles or sort finances, but risks include fewer program seats, limited funding, and potential visa delays. Assess readiness to decide the optimal application time.

title: Misiorowski perfect into 7th, sets rookie record
content: Brewers rookie Jacob Misiorowski took a perfect game into the seventh inning of his second career start Friday night, becoming the first pitcher to start his big league career with 11 consecutive hitless innings as a starter since 1900.

title: Suarez, managers suspended for Padres-L.A. feud
content: Major League Baseball has suspended Padres reliever Robert Suarez for three games (pending appeal) and managers Mike Shildt and Dave Roberts for one each, the aftermath of a feud between the teams that boiled over Thursday night in L.A.

title: Devers, facing Boston, clarifies first-base mindset
content: New Giants slugger Rafael Devers, while still shying away from discussing his past relationship with the Red Sox, did provide some insight Friday into why he is willing to play first base in San Francisco after refusing to do so in Boston.

title: Raleigh hits 2 HRs for 29, breaks Bench's record
content: Cal Raleigh broke Johnny Bench's record for home runs by a catcher before the All-Star break, hitting his major-league-leading 28th and 29th in the Mariners' 9-4 victory over the Cubs on Friday.

title: Dodgers donate $1M to families affected by raids
content: The Dodgers have donated $1 million to assist families impacted by two weeks of immigration raids in Southern California.

title: Wisconsin sues Miami for tampering with transfer
content: The University of Wisconsin filed a lawsuit Friday claiming Miami's football team broke the law by tampering with a Badgers player.

title: Canelo-Crawford winner can earn knockout bonus
content: Turki Alalshikh says the winner of September's showdown between pound-for-pound greats Canelo Alvarez and Terence Crawford will receive a bonus if either fighter ends the affair by knockout.

title: Senegal women's hoops team denied U.S. visas
content: The prime minister of Senegal said the women's basketball team has canceled plans to train in the U.S. after visa applications of five players and seven officials were not approved.

title: 'Not a Cinderella story': Coastal Carolina's rise as a college baseball power
content: Riding a 26-game win streak, the Chanticleers are on the cusp of a second national title in 10 years.

title: Passan: How the Red Sox 'absolutely botched' the Devers divorce
content: As Devers prepares to play against his former team, a look inside the clubhouse culture that helped cause the divorce.

title: Rankings of MLB starters, relievers and their arsenal of pitches over the past three seasons
content: A stat rooted in Game Theory reveals who's maximizing their arsenals, and who's leaving outs on the table.

title: Power Rankings: Can anyone unseat the Tigers at No. 1?
content: With a third week in a row atop our list, Detroit is the team with the most consecutive weeks at No. 1 in 2025.

title: Flamengo stun Chelsea in another big Club World Cup upset
content: Chelsea's tournament chances took a serious hit as they were outclassed and outplayed by Flamengo in Philadelphia. Here's what you need to know from Friday in the Club World Cup.

title: The USMNT is a mess. That's the price of the U.S. becoming a 'soccer country'
content: The more the U.S. cares about soccer and produces better players, the more dysfunctional the USMNT becomes. That's just how it is.

title: Richards saves the day for the USMNT on a night when the front line couldn't
content: The United States has advanced at the Gold Cup, but the performances from the attacking players must improve.

title: At Jackie Robinson's high school, a fire-ravaged city rebuilds
content: After 1 in 4 students lost their homes or were displaced by the Eaton fire, their school held them together.

title: 'The Lakers can finally be run like a real business': Leaguewide reaction to the stunning sale
content: The Lakers have spent decades lagging behind other NBA teams in ways known -- and not. This sale presents a massive opportunity for them to catch up -- and expedite their chase for title No. 18.

title: 'He can do anything': Why Liverpool spent big to sign Wirtz
content: Liverpool have broken their transfer record to sign Florian Wirtz from Bayer Leverkusen for an initial £100m, but what is so special about him?

title: Bayern use late goal to top Boca, advance at CWC
content: Michael Olise fired Bayern Munich into the knockout stages of the Club World Cup, scoring in the 84th minute for a 2-1 win over Boca Juniors on Friday night.

title: LAFC out of Club World Cup after late penalty miss
content: LAFC was eliminated from the FIFA Club World Cup after Denis Bouanga had a penalty saved deep into stoppage time of a 1-0 loss to Esperance Sportive de Tunis in Nashville on Friday.

title: Chelsea's Jackson sorry for red: 'I let you down'
content: Chelsea boss Enzo Maresca has said Nicolas Jackson is in a "bad moment" after picking up his second red card in four matches as the Blues lost 3-1 to Flamengo at the Club World Cup.

title: Sources: Rashford plans Man Utd training return
content: Marcus Rashford is planning to return to training with Manchester United next month if a deal to leave Old Trafford has not been agreed, sources have told ESPN.

title: Inter's Acerbi threatens PSG fan over UCL taunt
content: Inter Milan defender Francesco Acerbi lost his cool after a Club World Cup fan wearing a Paris St Germain shirt in Seattle taunted him about last month's Champions League final, with the Italian threatening to beat him up if the teasing continued.

title: Durant buys minority stake in soccer club PSG
content: Phoenix Suns forward Kevin Durant has purchased a minority stake in Champions League winner Paris Saint-Germain, the Ligue 1 club said Friday.

title: South Korea lifts 26-year ban on foreign GKs
content: A 26-year ban on foreign goalkeepers in South Korea's top flight has been lifted for the start of the 2026 season.

title: Diamonds in the rough: Late-round gems of the 2025 NHL draft
content: These seven players are unlikely to be first-rounders, but all have a path to NHL success down the road.

title: Who are the best players in the 2026 NFL draft class? We picked the top five at every position
content: Matt Miller and Jordan Reid stack their early top-fives at every position and break down the players they'll be watching during the 2025 season.

title: PLL Week 4 preview: What to watch at Whipsnakes' homecoming
content: The action heads to Baltimore this weekend. Check here for the full schedule, key stats, injury notes, more.

title: MLB mock draft 2.0: Kiley McDaniel predicts the first 40 picks
content: The Men's College World Series is bringing the top of next month's draft into better focus, starting with a new No. 1 pick.

title: Hill or Rountree: Which fighter has the best UFC knockout?
content: Two of elite knockout artists in the UFC's light heavyweight division will square off in the main event at UFC Fight Night, but which fighter has the best KO victory?

title: Barnwell picks the NFL's top luxuries: The best players at 11 specialized roles
content: Gadget player, slot cornerback, swing tackle, backup quarterback -- these players are the best at their very specific roles.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Arsenal, Chelsea eye Milan's Leão
content: AC Milan are willing to listen to offers for Rafael Leão. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Fantasy football: Values for CMC, Tyreek and more top storylines for 2025
content: Mike Clay, Daniel Dopp and Field Yates enjoy a robust conversation about the topics that fascinate them most heading into this fantasy season.

title: Rematch review -- a soccer game that's brilliant even if you don't like the sport
content: Sloclap's soccer simulation pares the beautiful game down to the essentials -- and it's a blast to play.

title: 'My intel community is wrong': Trump slams spy chief Gabbard on Iran
content: seasoned journalists and passionate writers tirelessly sift through the vast tapestry of global events to bring you the latest news and diverse perspectives round the clock . we strive to keep you informed about the ever-evolving world, delivering a nuanced understanding of international affairs to our readers .

title: CBI registers case against former Chief Manager of JNPA and private entities over ₹800 cr. alleged scam
content: According to CBI’s officials, the case was registered on June 18, 2025, on allegation that criminal conspiracy was hatched amongst JNPA officials and private persons and entities, which caused the loss.

title: Tamil Nadu Government’s initiative to train tribal students for exams such as JEE, AIEEE be renewed, demands activist Karthik
content: Activist Karthik said the G.O. published on October 15, 2013, enabled training 50 tribal students for two years in private coaching centres at a cost of ₹2 lakh per student

title: Odisha floods: 50,000 people affected by flash flood in Subarnarekha River
content: Flash flood in Subarnarekha River affects 50,000 people in Odisha’s Balasore district, relief operations underway

title: Anna University sexual assault case: Plea in Madras High Court insists on inquiring Annamalai to find out who is that ‘sir’
content: Litigant says, it is necessary to inquire former BJP State president since he claims to be in possession of incriminating materials

title: Ahmedabad Air India plane crash: Last rites of crew member Irfan Shaikh held in Pimpri Chinchwad
content: The Shaikh family received 22-year-old Irfan’s remains after a DNA match on June 20, and they were brought to Pune in the early hours of the day

title: Rajnath Singh briefed by top military brass on border security, arrangements for Amarnath
content: Chief of the Army Staff General Upendra Dwivedi, General Officer Commanding-in-Chief, Northern Command Lt Gen Pratik Sharma and other senior officers including commanding officers of all units attended the meeting

title: Ensure treatment of ailing jailed separatist leader Shabir Shah, allow family to meet him: Mirwaiz, Mehbooba to Centre
content: Hurriyat chairman Mirwaiz Umar Farooq said incarcerated separatist Shabir Shah’s wife had filed a bail plea “on his grave medical condition”, but was rejected

title: India set to integrate rare blood donor registry with e-Rakt Kosh
content: The integration will allow those with rare blood groups to access a centralized system developed under the National Health Mission (NHS), providing details on blood banks, blood availability, and blood donation camps across the country.

title: Process of reviving Salem Steel Plant at preliminary stage: Union Minister H.D. Kumaraswamy
content: The Union Minister participated in the International Yoga Day celebrations at Salem Steel Plant and performed asanas

title: Yoga has become a mass movement in Andhra Pradesh: CM Chandrababu Naidu
content: Speaking at the International Day of Yoga – 2025 (IDY-2025) celebrations on the Beach Road, Mr. Naidu said yoga promotes holistic well-being of the practitioner.

title: How PM Modi celebrated International Yoga Day since 2015
content: Recognising its universal appeal, on December 11, 2014, the United Nations proclaimed June 21 as the International Day of Yoga by resolution 69/131.

title: Participants in jubilant mood after their yoga performance with PM Modi, CM Naidu in Vizag
content: Officials of Vizianagaram and Srikakulam districts expressed happiness with the participation of more than 50,000 common people of the region in the celebrations organised in Visakhapatnam.

title: DGCA asks Air India to remove three officials from roles related to crew rostering
content: DGCA order, a copy of which has been reviewed by The Hindu states that internal disciplinary proceedings must be initiated against these officials without delay.

title: Extension of Kochi Water Metro service proposed in developing Kadambrayar as a tourism destination
content: This was among the few recommendations that were included in a Detailed Project Report for the proposed enhancement of Kadambrayar tourism destination centre

title: In poll bound Bihar, Nitish Kumar increases pension to ₹1,100 per month instead of ₹400
content: The announcement is seen to counter the promises by the opposition Rashtriya Janata Dal (RJD) leader Tejashwi Yadav. All beneficiaries will receive the revised pension starting from the month of July

title: Four militants arrested in Manipur
content: The police also apprehended a member of the outlawed PLA from Kakching Turel Wangma in Kakching district on Friday

title: Moral policing shadows couples in Chennai
content: Many young men and women complain of similar experiences of being victims of the moral police brigade, that have left them traumatised

title: DPR proposes multi-pronged infrastructure facelift for developing Kadambrayar as a tourism destination
content: Developing Kayaking routes along designated stretches of the Kadambrayar River is one of the proposals to promote eco-tourism and attract adventure seekers.

title: Madras High Court’s 133-year-old heritage building gets a new lease of life
content: A committee comprising Justices R. Subramanian, R. Suresh Kumar, P.T. Asha and N. Mala restore the long neglected ground floor of the two-storey building

title: High tension tower in middle of road bothering Hebbal residents for years
content: When trucks and buses pass through the tower, the top of the vehicles collide with the metal bars of the electric construct that not only deform the bars, but also create sharp blaring noises, especially at night

title: International Yoga Day 2025: A sea of humanity descends on Beach Road
content: The brightly-illuminated road, the large gathering of people, already settled on the green mat laid on both sides of the road, made one wonder whether day break had already occurred.

title: Israel-Iran conflict: India to evacuate citizens of Nepal, Sri Lanka from Iran
content: The Union Government has launched Operation Sindhu to evacuate Indian nationals from Iran, given the deteriorating situation as a result of the ongoing conflict between Iran and Israel

title: School merger idea a strategy to deprive poor from accessing education, says Akhilesh
content: SP leader Ram Pratap Singh adds that reviewing and reducing school infrastructure is not a prudent approach, demanding for increase in budget allocation for primary and secondary education

title: International Yoga Day 2025 — In pictures
content: Andhra Pradesh bagged Guinness record for staging the maximum number of people doing Surya Namaskar at a place.

content: ‘The  Bharat Mata concept and saffron flag have been part of the Indian tradition for long, says former Kerrala BJP state president K. Surendran

title: DMK attempting to conceal its fear of defeat: L. Murugan
content: L. Murugan was speaking to reporters on the sidelines of the International Yoga Day celebrations at the National Institute of Siddha in Tambaram

title: Yeast shows physics can give rise to multicellular life sans mutations
content: A new study by NCBS scientists offers an ‘unconventional view’ of how major changes first arise in the course of evolution

title: Operation Sindhu: 517 Indian nationals brought back from Iran so far, says MEA
content: More Indian nationals, including students, arrived in Delhi late Friday night and in the early hours of Saturday after being evacuated from Iran as its military confrontation with Israel intensified

title: "Israel Has Also Spread Chaos": Video Of US Envoy's Freudian Slip Goes Viral
content: US Ambassador to the United Nations Camille Shea on Friday blamed Israel for spreading chaos and terror before realising it was a Freudian slip. Ms Shea then corrected herself, replacing "Israel" with "Iran".

title: "Contrary To Voter Privacy": Poll Body Sources On Voting Footage Demands
content: Countering demands that footage from poll booths be retained for more than 45 days, the Election Commission sources have said that while they seem reasonable on the face of it, they will adversely impact the privacy and security of voters.

title: Man Linked To Babbar Khalsa Terror Group Arrested In Punjab, 6 Pistols Seized
content: The Punjab Police on Saturday busted a terror module linked to the banned outfit Babbar Khalsa International (BKI) in Amritsar.

title: US-Iran Nuclear Talks A "Cover Up" For Israel Attack: Iran's Foreign Minister
content: When asked if the two-week time frame given by US President Donald Trump is enough to finalise a deal with the United States, Araghchi said that it was up to the Trump administration to "show their determination for going for a negotiated solution."

title: Shah Rukh Khan's 'Mannat' Inspected Over Coastal Rules Violation Complaint
content: Officials of Mumbai's civic body, Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC), and the forest department have inspected actor Shah Rukh Khan's sea-facing bungalow 'Mannat' after a complaint of alleged violation of the Coastal Regulation Zone (CRZ).

title: 'Iran Will Destroy Zionism': Israel PM Shares Father's 2010 Speech On Tehran
content: In his speech delivered on his 100th birthday, Benzion Netanyahu warned his son and Israel about the existential threat to Jews from Iran.

title: Haryana Chief Minister Announces 5 Minutes Yoga Break In Government Offices
content: Haryana Chief Minister Nayab Singh Saini was addressing a gathering at a state-level programme organised on the occasion of the 11th International Day of Yoga.

title: Indian Evacuees Chant "Hindustan Zindabad" As 2nd Batch Returns From Iran
content: Most of the evacuated Indians in the second batch are medical students pursuing MBBS degrees at Iranian universities.

title: 3 Air India Officials Removed, Aviation Body Threatens To Withdraw Licence
content: Civil aviation regulator DGCA has ordered the immediate removal of three senior Air India officials, including a divisional vice president, from all responsibilities related to flight crew scheduling and rostering.

title: Tulsi Gabbard's Clarification On Iran After Trump's 2nd Rebuke In A Week
content: Director of National Intelligence Tulsi Gabbard on Saturday said the US believes that Iran could have a nuclear weapon built "within weeks to months", hours after she was snubbed by President Donald Trump.

title: Earthquake Of Magnitude 5.1 Hits Iran, Sparks Theories Of Nuclear Testing
content: The earthquake has now triggered a wave of speculations about whether Tehran has tested a nuclear weapon. It has also sparked concern because it struck near a city with a space and missile complex.

title: Aviation Body Orders Removal Of 3 Air India Officials Over Crew Rostering
content: Aviation safety watchdog DGCA has ordered Tata Group-owned Air India to remove its three officials, including a divisional vice president, from all roles and responsibilities related to crew scheduling and rostering over serious lapses.

title: Leopard Drags Away 4-Year-Old In Tamil Nadu, Mutilated Body Found In Forest
content: A leopard killed a four-year-old girl from her house in Tamil Nadu's Coimbatore district on Wednesday evening. Her body was found in a mutilated condition inside a forest on Saturday.

title: In-Laws Claimed She Ran Away. Then Her Body Was Found In A 10-Foot Pit
content: The decomposed body of a woman was recovered from a 10-foot-deep ditch in a residential street in Haryana's Faridabad on Friday.

title: In Pics: How International Yoga Day Was Celebrated Across India, World
content: Millions of people across India and the world participated in various events on Saturday to mark the International Day of Yoga.

title: Building On Fire In Tel Aviv As Israel, Iran Trade New Strikes: 10 Points
content: Israel and Iran on Saturday traded new strikes hours after Iranian Foreign Minister Abbas Araghchi held talks with European foreign ministers and said Tehran would not negotiate over its nuclear programme while under threat.

title: Israel-Iran Attacks Live Updates: Iran, Israel Launch Fresh Attacks As Tehran Rules Out Nuclear Talks
content: Israel-Iran Attacks Live Updates: Iran and Israel exchanged fresh attacks early on Saturday, a day after Tehran said it would not negotiate over its nuclear programme while under threat and Europe tried to keep peace talks alive.

title: Nitish Kumar's Big Move Ahead Of Polls, Monthly Pension Hiked To Rs 1,100
content: Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar today announced an increase in the monthly pension for elderly, disabled persons, and widowed women from Rs 400 to Rs 1,100.

title: Vizag Yoga Event Creates New Guinness World Record With 3 Lakh Attendees
content: The event was held on a 28-km stretch from RK Beach to Bhogapuram. It broke the record set in 2023 by Surat by hosting a yoga session with 1.47 lakh participants at one location.

title: Yoga should guide the world from conflict to cooperation, says PM Modi
content: The Prime Minister led the 11th IDY-2025 celebrations in Visakhapatnam. Chief Minister N. Chandrababu Naidu commended the people’s overwhelming response.

title: Senior citizen robbed by goon in fake accident scam on M.G. Road in Bengaluru, victim struggles to get FIR registered
content: Bystanders, and even the bank staff where he went to withdraw money to give the mugger refused to help and share the CCTV footage

title: BJP MLA files NCR after Vande Bharat train clash
content: The incident occurred Thursday evening over a seat dispute and an alleged objectionable sitting posture. The confrontation escalated at Jhansi station,

title: Thunderstorm likely in Delhi on June 21: IMD
content: Accordingo the Indian Meteorological Department, a thunderstorm is likely in Delhi on Saturday (June 21) night

title: Yoga can help in creating a healthy nation, says Union Minister Suresh Gopi
content: Actor Mohanlal participates in a Yoga day celebrations held at the Cochin International Airport Ltd convention centre in Nedumbassery.

title: Eknath Shinde has shown the 'real Shiv Sena' to everybody: Amit Shah
content: The remarks come a day after both the Eknath Shinde and Uddhav Thackeray factions, now called Shiv Sena and Shiv Sena (UBT), respectively, celebrated the undivided party's foundation day

title: Bengaluru-Mangaluru train services disrupted as boulders fall on railway track between Yedakumari and Shirabagilu stations
content: Boulders fell on the track around 4.23 a.m on June 21, forcing the authorities to regulate the trains, said a communique from the South Western Railway

title: Sharmila accuses Jagan of supporting ‘objectionable’ comments by YSRCP cadre
content: Despite the Centre’s failure to fulfil bifurcation promises, TDP, JSP, and YSRCP are supporting the BJP, says the APCC president

title: Skyrocketing food prices dulls lure of movie outing for the middle-class
content: As expenses mount, cinemas resort to charging high prices for snacks and drinks to offset the fall in footfall but end up with alienating middle-class families, who now believe that the experience, once their primary source of entertainment, is no longer worth the cost

title: Wealth from waste: how crop residue can provide nutritious cattle fodder, make farming eco-friendly
content: Burning of agricultural residue is a major cause of air pollution in the country, but what if the ‘waste’ material could be turned into fodder for animals and input for biogas generation? A revolutionary technology being developed by scientists at CSIR-IICT aims to do that and more

title: Yoga is the pause button humanity needs, to breathe, to balance, to become whole again: PM Modi
content: Addressing the 11th International Yoga day participants in Visakhapatnam, Mr. Modi said when India proposed June 21 to be celebrated as International Yoga day in the United Nations, in a short time 175 countries accepted it

title: International Yoga Day LIVE updates: Yoga teaches us we are not isolated individuals but integral parts of nature: PM Modi
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi is meeting the students and other participants of the Yoga Day celebration after his speech

title: 25,000 tribal students perform 108 Surya Namaskarams in 108 minutes in Vizag
content: Official recognition for a world record will be announced during Yogandhra-2025 celebrations on June 21, says Lokesh, adding that yoga will be part of the school curriculum

title: Kolkata Police detain Union Minister Sukanta Majumder from meeting ‘dissident’ British-Indian doctor
content: The BJP legislator said that the doctor had invited him to his house for tea, and accused the police of blocking him from approaching the doctor’s house, which was allegedly located next to the residence of Trinamool Congress MP Abhishek Banerjee

title: CBI arrests two from Kolkata for ₹183 crore fake bank guarantee fraud in M.P.
content: ‘The arrests exposed an inter-state gang involved in helping companies obtain fake bank guarantees to secure government projects in various States,’ the CBI said.

title: 21 officials suspended over ₹40-crore ‘farm scam’ in Maharashtra
content: According to officials, Out of the ₹80 crore received, ₹40 crore was misappropriated in Ambad and Ghansawangi tehsils

title: Sowing seeds of mistrust in Assam
content: The Muslim-majority district of Dhubri, in Assam, close to the Bangladesh border, has remained largely calm after experiencing some fraught periods following the demolition of the Babri Masjid in 1992. This month, however, cattle body parts were allegedly found at a Hanuman temple on successive days, sparking communal tensions. Rahul Karmakar reports on a district on edge

title: Operation Sindhu: 290 Indian students return from Iran, land in Delhi
content: Operation Sindhu evacuates Indian students from Iran amid conflict with Israel, with special Iranian cooperation and gratitude expressed

title: U.P. CM inaugurates 91.35 km long Gorakhpur Link Expressway
content: By prioritising infrastructure, Uttar Pradesh has shed the ‘BIMARU’ tag and emerged as an ‘emerging’ State, he adds

title: ‘City ready to execute ban on refuelling of overage vehicles’
content: ANPR cameras have been installed at all fuelling stations in city to help identify, deny fuel to overage vehicles from July 1, says CAQM; 4.90 lakh such vehicles identified through the tech already, it adds

title: Pressure of parents can deter schools to do exorbitant fee hike, says RSS education wing
content: Ravindra Kanhere emphasises parental pressure on schools to prevent exorbitant fee hikes, discusses education policies and Vidya Bharati’s expansion

title: Yogi inaugurates Gorakhpur Link Expressway, says U.P. is no longer a ‘BIMARU’ State
content: CM says the expressway will provide world-class connectivity to Azamgarh and the adjoining Sant Kabir Nagar, Ambedkar Nagar and Gorakhpur; accuses previous govt. of ‘failing in development’

title: T.N. government initiates steps to roll out HPV vaccination for girls aged 14
content: The State has initiated the process to procure the vaccine to prevent cervical cancer, which is the second most common cancer in women. The Tamil Nadu Medical Services Corporation has floated tenders for procurement, and the supply is most likely to reach hospitals in another three months

title: Cognizant to invest $183 million for new India campus, add 8,000 jobs
content: Cognizant invests $182.76 million in new campus in Vishakapatanam, creating 8,000 jobs, with operations starting in 2029

title: Stray dog menace: three shelter homes to be set up in Kannur
content: Decision follows concern after a spate of dog bite incidents reported in the district. To prevent a potential rabies outbreak, stray dogs within the city limits will be captured, vaccinated, and relocated to the shelters

title: Use of banned food colours: safety squads intensify checks in Kozhikode
content: 5 regional squads are part of inspections, which will cover food-based ventures near schools, colleges, and other educational institutions

title: Ban on single-use plastic: food sector flags concerns
content: Kerala Hotel and Restaurants Association is planning to approach court seeking a practical solution to the issue

title: Demand to curb unchecked bamboo harvesting in Wayanad
content: Bamboo mafia smuggling tonnes of bamboo with support of Forest and panchayat officials, alleges forum

title: All returning athletes in Tony Hawk's Pro Skater 3 + 4 revealed
content: a total of 21 skaters from the original games and other series entries return in THPS 3 + 4 . illustrious names like Elissa Steamer, the first female skater to become playable in the franchise in the original Tony Hawk's Pro Skater, and rodney Mullen, the iconic originator .

title: Ranking the 10 most unbreakable records in college football
content: college football has evolved greatly over the years, but there are some records and accomplishments that have stood the test of time . we've examined the past 75 years in college football, tracing back to the 1950 season, and have ranked the 10 most "unbreakable" records in the sport, listing them in order of least likely to be topped.

title: Expert picks, best bets for UFC Fight Night and PFL semifinals
content: light heavyweights jamahal Hill and Khalil Rountree will clash in the main event . MMA veteran and former UFC fighter Kevin Lee will make his PFL debut against Gadzhi Rabadanov . former Bellator champion Liz Carmouche takes on Elora Dana .

title: Liverpool sign Germany's Wirtz in club-record deal
content: german international Florian Wirtz signs a five-year deal with the premier league champions . the deal is worth a total of £116 million ($156.27 million) a source says the deal includes an initial £100 million payment with £16 million in add-ons to the deal . wirtz says he wants to have something completely new to go out of the Bundesliga .

title: From crowd-surfing with the Stanley Cup to Dairy Queen: Inside Brad Marchand's post-title tour
content: it's been 14 years since Brad Marchand last had the chance to party with the Stanley Cup . he's older and wiser -- in the sense that he won't be getting a misspelled tattoo . but the man still knows how to celebrate a championship .

title: 2025 NBA Finals: Pacers dominate at home in Game 6
content: the Pacers are able to force a game 7 of the NBA Finals . the Thunder were down 8-2 in the first game of the season . they missed their opening six shots, a streak that eventually grew to eight . a timeout was a precursor of an onslaught .

title: Transfer window weekly: Napoli chase Núñez; Chelsea eye Joâo Pedro
content: the club world cup transfer window has closed . but the club's main window is open with the rest of Europe to follow on July 1 . sportsmail's reporters hearing about possible deals every Friday until September . 'the anfield wrap' is looking at which Premier League games Liverpool might have after Champions League knockout games .

title: 2025 AAC preview: Can Army and Navy throw off the balance of power again?
content: both programs had slipped in recent years; blocking rule changes targeted cut-blocking common with service-academy option attacks . this time last year, you could pretty easily paint a picture of college football leaving both programs behind .

title: 🤝 NBA draft trades: 5 deals to shake up first round
content: the NBA offseason has officially arrived . there are massive storylines yet to resolve, including the Los Angeles Lakers sale . the NBA draft is just days away, and free agency just days after that . here are five trades featuring 10 different teams .

title: Is the Club World Cup important? Yes, just ask the South American teams
content: Boca Juniors fans get ready for the club world cup with chants and drums on Miami beach . the tournament feels unmistakably South American, but in the u.s. it's a global tournament . many of their UEFA counterparts shrug with apathy at the expanded tournament, noting its lack of history .

title: Why there's a 30-foot, 15K-pound fiberglass tiger circling the Men's College World Series
content: a version of this story ran before the semifinal round of the men's college world series . it has been updated to reflect LSU advancing the championship series against Coastal Carolina . "LSU Pregame" was the first song, and Greene's uncle, Jacob Stone, steered the 15,000-pound fiberglass tiger around traffic .
